It has a 3.5-inch TFT display with a resolution of 320x480 pixels and is powered by a Qualcomm MSM7227 Snapdragon S1 chipset, 600 MHz ARM 11 CPU, and Adreno 200 GPU. The device has 4GB of internal storage and supports microSD cards up to 32GB. It has a 3.15MP camera with AF and can record videos at 480p resolution. The nuvifone A50 also has a 3.5mm audio jack and supports Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 2.0, A2DP, EDR, GPS, and Garmin navigation. It has a 1150mAh removable Li-Ion battery that can last up to 150 hours in standby mode and up to 5 hours in talk time. The device is available in black.

generated.out: The Infinix Note 30 5G is a high-end smartphone that was released in 2023. It features a 6.78-inch IPS LCD display with a 120Hz refresh rate and a peak brightness of 580 nits. The device is powered by the Mediatek MT6833P Dimensity 6080 chipset, which is paired with 4/8GB of RAM and 128/256GB of internal storage. It has a triple-camera setup on the rear, with a 108MP primary sensor, a 2MP depth sensor, and a QVGA sensor. On the front, it has a 16MP selfie camera. The device supports 4G, 5G, and Wi-Fi 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac, dual-band, Wi-Fi Direct, Bluetooth 5.0, NFC, and FM radio. It also has a fingerprint sensor on the side, accelerometer, gyro, proximity, and compass sensors. The device is available in three colors: Magic Black, Interstellar Blue, and Sunset Gold. The price of the device starts at ₹ 12,999.

generated.out: The Cat S52 is a rugged smartphone that offers advanced features and durability for those who need a reliable device for their professional or personal needs. With a 5.65-inch IPS LCD display, the S52 provides a clear and vivid viewing experience, even in harsh environments. The device is powered by the Mediatek MT6765 Helio P35 chipset and 4GB of RAM, ensuring smooth performance and multitasking capabilities. The main camera features a 12MP sensor with f/1.8 aperture and dual pixel PDAF, allowing for high-quality photos and videos even in low-light conditions. The selfie camera is an 8MP sensor, and both cameras are capable of recording 1080p video at 30fps. The S52 also features a fingerprint sensor on the rear panel, accelerometer, gyro, proximity, and compass sensors, as well as NFC and USB Type-C 2.0 connectivity. The device is rated IP68 dust/water resistant (up to 1.5m for 35 min) and drop-to-concrete resistance from up to 1.5m, making it suitable for use in harsh environments. The S52 is available in black and has a price of around 440 EUR.

The EF61 has a 2.5-inch TFT display with 256K colors and a secondary CSTN display with 4096 colors. The phone supports SMS, EMS, and MMS messaging, as well as WAP 2.0/xHTML and HTML browsers. It also has a Java-enabled MIDP 2.0 browser and supports games, a photo editor, voice memo, and stopwatch features. The phone has a standby time of up to 225 hours and a talk time of up to 3 hours.

It has a 3.0-inch display with a resolution of 320x480 pixels and is powered by a Qualcomm MSM8255 Snapdragon S2 chipset. The device has 1GB of internal storage and 512MB of RAM, and it supports microSD cards up to 32GB. The Xperia active has a 5MP camera with LED flash and can record 720p video. It also has a 3.5mm audio jack and supports Bluetooth 2.1, A2DP, and EDR. The phone is rated IP67, meaning it is dust and water resistant up to 1 meter for 30 minutes. The Xperia active runs on Android 2.3 (Gingerbread) and can be upgraded to Android 4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich). It has a 1200mAh battery that provides up to 351 hours of standby time and up to 4 hours and 53 minutes of talk time. The phone is available in Orange/Black and White/Black color options and has a price of around 170 EUR.

generated.out: The Sony Ericsson Xperia mini pro is a compact and stylish smartphone that was released in 2011. It features a 3.0-inch LED-backlit LCD display with a resolution of 320x480 pixels and a 3:2 aspect ratio, providing a pixel density of approximately 192 ppi. The device is powered by a Qualcomm MSM8255 Snapdragon S2 chipset and 1.0 GHz Scorpion CPU, and includes 512MB of RAM and 400MB of internal storage. It has a 5MP rear camera with LED flash and 720p video recording capabilities, as well as a VGA front-facing camera for selfies. The Xperia mini pro also includes Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 2.1, A2DP, GPS, and a 3.5mm audio jack. It runs on the Android 2.3 (Gingerbread) operating system, which can be upgraded to Android 4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich). The device is available in black, white, pink, and turquoise colors and has a removable Li-Ion 1200 mAh battery that provides up to 331 hours of standby time and up to 5 hours and 40 minutes of talk time. The Xperia mini pro is priced at around 140 EUR.

generated.out: The Sony Ericsson Xperia Arc S is a high-end smartphone that was released in 2011. It features a 4.2-inch LED-backlit LCD display with a resolution of 480x854 pixels, 16:9 ratio (~233 ppi density), and is protected by scratch-resistant glass. The device is powered by a Qualcomm MSM8255T Snapdragon S2 chipset, 1.4 GHz Scorpion CPU, and Adreno 205 GPU. It has 1GB of internal storage and 512MB of RAM. The phone has an 8MP rear camera with LED flash, panorama, and can record 720p video. It also has a 0.3MP front camera. The Xperia Arc S has Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n, DLNA, hotspot, Bluetooth 2.1, A2DP, EDR, GPS, A-GPS; GLONASS, and a 3.5mm jack. It runs on Android 2.3.4 (Gingerbread), 4.0.4 (Ice Cream Sandwich), and is not upgradable to 4.1 (Jelly Bean). The phone has a microSD card slot, and 8GB of internal storage is included. It has a 1500mAh removable Li-Po battery that provides up to 460 hours of standby time and up to 7 hours and 25 minutes of talk time. The Xperia Arc S is available in Pure White, Midnight Blue, Misty Silver, Gloss Black, and Sakura Pink colors. It has a price of around 210 EUR.
